name: antsAlignOrigin
description: antsAlignOrigin, applied to an input image, transforms it according to a reference image and a transform (or a set of transforms).

inputs.name: Dimensionality
inputs.description: This option forces the image to be treated as a specified-dimensional image. If not specified, antsWarp tries to infer the dimensionality from the input image.

inputs.name: Input image
inputs.description: Currently, the only input objects supported are image objects. However, the current framework allows for warping of other objects such as meshes and point sets.

inputs.name: Reference image
inputs.description: For warping input images, the reference image defines the spacing, origin, size, and direction of the output warped image.

inputs.name: Output
inputs.description: One can either output the warped image or, if the boolean is set, one can print out the displacement field based on the composite transform and the reference image.

output-files.name: Aligned Image
output-files.description: The output is the aligned image.

author: ANTs Developers
